metadata.dc:description: BACKGROUND Waugh's syndrome is the combination of intussusception and intestinal malrotation. The first case was described in 1911, with few cases being reported since then. CLINICAL CASE A 7 month-old infant with fever, vomiting and rectal bleeding. Distension and an abdominal mass was found on examination. An exploratory laparotomy was preformed that found a combination of intussusception and intestinal malrotation, which was treated succesfully. CONCLUSION We consider that this combination is not sufficiently diagnosed very often, leading to its disappearance.
